entry.title: Westminster Abbey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 39 English and British monarchs have been crowned at Westminster Abbey (pictured) since 1066?

entry.title: Frank LeMaster (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that as a college football player, Frank LeMaster changed from being a fullback to the starting halfback, to reserve halfback, to tight end, to linebacker, back to halfback and then linebacker again?

entry.title: Lynch/Oz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the documentary Lynch/Oz incorporates hundreds of film clips to illustrate the influence of The Wizard of Oz on the work of filmmaker David Lynch?

entry.title: Edward Kimball (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 19th-century American evangelist Dwight L. Moody was converted to Christianity in the stock room of a shoe store by his Sunday School teacher Edward Kimball?

entry.title: his coronation (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Edward VI was only nine years old on the day of his coronation?

entry.title: Bachtiar Djafar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Bachtiar Djafar was the first mayor of Medan, Indonesia, to be of Malay descent?

entry.title: Güzel İstanbul (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the destroyed plinth of Gürdal Duyar's nude sculpture Güzel İstanbul contained reliefs of a fig, a pomegranate, a honeysuckle and a bee to represent different aspects of Istanbul?

entry.title: Caity Baser (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Caity Baser followed up her 2022 singles "Friendly Sex", "X & Y", and "Kiss You" with "Friendly Sex (Angrier)", "X & Y (What I Didn't Say)", and "Kiss You, Pt. 2", respectively?
